sections.legal_compliance: Providing Data as Required by Law

content.intro: This privacy policy explains how moonpacket collects, uses, stores, and protects your personal data. We value your privacy and are committed to handling your data in a transparent and secure manner.
content.data_collection: The types of data we collect include:
content.data_usage: The purposes for which we use your data include:
content.data_sharing: We do not sell your personal data. We may share data with the following third parties:
content.data_security: We take the following security measures to protect your data:
content.user_rights: You have the right to request:
content.cookies: We use cookies and similar technologies:
content.third_party: We may use third-party services to assist us:
content.children_privacy: We do not intentionally collect personal information from children under the age of 13. If such information is discovered, we will delete it immediately.
content.international_transfers: Your data may be transferred to other countries. We ensure appropriate protective measures, including:
content.changes: We may update our privacy policy from time to time, and significant changes will be communicated to you as follows:
content.contact: For any privacy-related inquiries, please contact us:
content.legal_compliance: In order to comply with laws, KYC/AML, and requirements from law enforcement/judicial/competent authorities, moonpacket may provide necessary usage records, transaction traces, group/wallet/chat activities, KYC/AML data, etc., to authorities, investigative agencies, judicial entities, or other legally authorised units within the statutory or instructed scope. Such cooperation does not constitute a breach of contract or infringement; moonpacket is not liable for any damages arising from this.
